definitions.name: false positive (fp)
definitions.desc: ... an incorrect model decision whereby the model's decision is true/present, instead of false/absent. Example: the model indicates that there are inflammable items in the suitcase, but there aren't.

definitions.name: false negative (fn)
definitions.desc: ... an incorrect model decision whereby the model's decision is false/absent, instead of true/present. Example: A model indicates that there are no inflammable items in the suitcase, but there are.

definitions.name: true positive (tp)
definitions.desc: ... the model's decision is correct; true/present. Example: A model correctly indicates the presence of a disease.

definitions.name: true negative (tn)
definitions.desc: ... the model's decision is correct; false/absent. Example: A model correctly indicates the absence of a disease.
